meanings.definition: In a way that is not easily remembered or recalled.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was unmemorably long and boring.
meanings.sent2: She spoke unmemorably softly, barely audible to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician unmemorably forgot his own tricks during the show.
meanings.sent4: The melody drifted unmemorably through the empty hall, fading into silence.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers lingered unmemorably in the air, almost imperceptible.

meanings.sent1: The movie ended unmemorably, leaving no lasting impression.
meanings.sent2: He waved unmemorably as he walked away, quickly blending into the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The joke fell unmemorably flat, eliciting no laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her words echoed unmemorably in his mind, soon forgotten amidst the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the dish was unmemorably bland, lacking any distinct flavor.
